alert.note: Alert for Adams; Webster (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 12:24AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Webster and southern Adams Counties through 100 AM CDT... At 1224 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Roseland, or 14 miles southwest of Hastings, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Bladen around 1230 AM CDT. Ayr around 1240 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Blue Hill and Rosemont. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
